items.title: Could a bubble be about to burst? What to know as gold and silver prices surge
items.summary: As prices soar amid global uncertainty, experts weigh in on whether the rally will last.

items.title: Nearly 50C: More temperature records smashed as 'heat dome' persists
items.summary: Australia claimed all of the top 15 hottest spots in the world over the 24 hours to 8am on Thursday.

items.title: Hastie says he won't challenge for leadership as Ley gives Nationals one-week ultimatum
items.summary: One of Liberal Party leader Sussan Ley's potential challengers has ducked out of the running, saying he doesn't have enough support.

items.title: Drowning victims' families 'in shock' but grateful after $150k raised in support
items.summary: Over $150,000 has been raised to support the families of two men who drowned in NSW, as their communities grapple with loss.

items.title: Domestic violence crisis under the microscope as Lake Cargelligo manhunt continues
items.summary: A 37-year-old council worker was out on bail and had an active apprehended violence order against him, lodged on behalf of the pregnant woman he is accused of fatally shooting.

items.title: $219 billion over five years: Government strikes last-minute hospital funding deal
items.summary: The recently announced funding allocation was triple the amount of the last agreement, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Friday.

items.title: Police investigate suspected double murder-suicide after four found dead in Perth
items.summary: A 50-year-old man, a 49-year-old woman and two teenage boys were found dead at their home in the Perth suburb of Mosman Park on Friday.

items.title: Trump says Americans will be 'safe' in Venezuela as he opens up travel route
items.summary: The airspace decision reflects broader efforts by the Trump administration to restore diplomatic engagement with Venezuela.

items.title: The end of doctor shopping? Why the government wants to track your medicines
items.summary: An estimated 1.5 million people in Australia experience some kind of harmful side effect from using medicine each year.

items.title: Israel releases 15 Palestinian bodies as truce deal shifts to next phase
items.summary: It marks the last hostage-detainee exchange between Israel and Hamas in the first phase of the US-brokered ceasefire.

items.title: 'Immensely harmful': Greenlandic mayor issues warning after US flag stunt
items.summary: The official, whose district includes the capital, said the people of Greenland were already worried and afraid amid recent developments.

items.title: Trump claims Putin will halt strikes for one week as Ukraine faces extreme cold
items.summary: Ukraine's state weather agency has forecast a drastic dip in temperatures to as low as minus 30C in coming days

items.title: Iran has its 'finger on the trigger'. But is it at its 'weakest' as US tensions soar?
items.summary: Tensions between the US and Iran are increasing, while reports indicate that the US is bolstering its military presence in the region.

items.title: No vaccines, no cure, and 'very dangerous'. Should we be worried about Nipah virus?
items.summary: Airports across Asia are on alert for the deadly virus.

items.title: Aly speaks after refusing to welcome Israeli president's visit as nationwide protests planned
items.summary: Organisers of nationwide protests argue the Isaac Herzog isn't welcome, while the prime minister has backed his visit.

items.title: Minns to consider creating public holiday fix for 'underserved' state
items.summary: With Anzac Day falling on a Saturday this year, NSW Premier Chris Minns has flagged creating a new public holiday.

items.title: Paterson says Ley has 'majority' support, Littleproud challenger speaks as spill motions loom
items.summary: Both the Liberal and National leaders are facing threats to their leadership ahead of parliament resuming next week.

items.title: Indigenous communities are questioning the government's response to the Perth Invasion Day attack
items.summary: The attack is being investigated as a potential terrorist event, with some saying the government should have taken warnings from First Nations people more seriously.

items.title: Chinese officials heading to Brisbane to investigate hot coffee attack on baby
items.summary: Baby Luka has undergone at least eight surgeries since the attack, which left his face and body severely burned.

items.title: 'Existential threat': The 'mirror life' risk fuelling doomsday fears
items.summary: Scientists warn some biological developments could have devastating consequences. One focus of growing concern is "mirror life".

items.title: Trump warns Iran 'time is running out' for nuclear deal amid US military build-up
items.summary: The US president said an "armada" of US warships is now in the Middle East, as Iran threatened a massive response to any strikes.

items.title: Remains found in Tasmania during search for missing Belgian hiker Celine Cremer
items.summary: A bushwalker found the remains during a search for the 31-year-old, who was last seen in the area near Cradle Mountain in 2023.

items.title: Border agents involved in deadly Minnesota shooting placed on 'administrative leave'
items.summary: It comes as Donald Trump said he would "de-escalate" in Minnesota amid mounting political pressure over his immigration crackdown.

items.title: Xi Jinping has dismissed two of China's most senior generals. What does this mean?
items.summary: The two men are "suspected of serious violations of discipline and the law", China's defence ministry said.
